186041754.review: Shadow of War is arguably the best Lord of the Rings game ever made if you want to feel like a god-like, unstoppable, bad ass, half ranger, half wraith, mind controlling, head chopping killing machine that also commands armies to conquer giant settlements all over middle earth. This game plays so unbelievably smooth and pushes the unique nemesis system to its brink. Visually stunning, a more than serviceable story, insanely satisfying and flashy combat similar to that of the Arkham games (I would say perfected freeflow combat) and faithful to Tolkein loreT, this game is a GEM and is another example of taking what made the first one so amazing and dialing that up to whole nother level. Its a shame that there is no news of another badass adventure in Middle Earth coming from Monolith Soft with the Nemesis system as any LOTR fan would undoubtedly be excited for that. Can be a little overwhelming at the start with how much power this game gives you at your fingertips but if you stick with it, it can get hard to put down.

If you liked Shadow of Mordor, you will definitely like this one.

185953189.review:
Giocone virtualmente infinito. Giocabilità alle stelle, molti titoli tripla A odierni dovrebbero prendere esempio. Grafica buona, storia molto bella (è comunque il Signore degli Anelli).
Inizialmente un po' confusionario per via della gestione delle missioni e dei poteri, da dopo un po' si prende confidenza e si va avanti tranquilli.
Strategia e azione nello stesso gioco. Conquistare le fortezze e gli accampamenti è interessante ed impegnativo, anche se dopo un bel po' di ore diventa un po' ripetitivo, ma sempre appagante. Le missioni della storia comunque sono molto belle.
Unico difetto a parte la leggera ripetitività è il fatto che alcuni ostacoli se affrontati leggermente in diagonale non consentono di oltrepassarli scavalcandoli, talvolta bisogna mettersi perfettamente perpendicolari mentre si corre, altrimenti ci si pianta inevitabilmente e si viene raggiunti dai nemici.
In ogni caso, a mio parere, uno dei migliori giochi dell'ultimo decennio. Molte spanne sopra a tanti titoli usciti fino ad adesso (2024).

185942009.review:
Une histoire franchement pas ouf, un gameplay qui laisse à désirer mais une gestion de l'armée sympa.

On va pas se mentir, si t'es fan du seigneur des anneaux et de Tolkien en règle général tu risque d'avoir des boutons. Mais c'est pas le sujet

Ce jeu est chiant. Le système de Némésis est sympa, lors de la découverte. Une fois que t'as passé cette phase, c'est ennuyant à mourir. Le scénario est éclaté, tu finis tout assez vite et après c'est du farm assez chiant et c'est tout le temps la même chose à chaque zone. Le jeu est pas hyper long mais vraiment comment ça traine... Jsuis arrivé à la fin du scénario principal en me disant vivement que ça se termine parce que c'est une purge (et le contenu hl... c'est vide). Jvais pas descendre les diverses quêtes parce qu'en vrai ça va ya de la diversité, mais le systeme de combat... Il faut en parler. Je précise que je joue à la manette mais franchement de A à Z le combat de rue ça va être X, X, X, X, X, Y pour contrer, X, X, X, X, X, X, X, X, A pour roulade, B éventuellement pour assommer un gonz et pouvoir l'enchaîner avec X... Tu martèles le même bouton tout le temps bonjour les crampes. Y a pas vraiment de diversité, tu peux utiliser des flèches mais bon... Les alliés passent constamment devant toi, t'empêchant de te battre correctement et au passage en les entraînant dans la mort. Ils t'empêchent des fois de dominer les capitaines qui vont se faire tuer par une flèche la seconde d'après, entraînant une frustration sans nom. On pourrait se dire que le fait que les capitaines aient des immunités ou puissent s'adapter au type de gameplay que tu martelles, te forçant donc à changer de méthode... Si tu n'étais pas limité aux actions que j'ai cité précédemment. Si le gars est invulnérable aux flèches, au gel et aux sauts, je peux vous dire que l'affrontement sera insupportable tellement tu feras des roulades et tu martèleras X et X (et si en plus il est enragé par les acrobaties... bon courage). Et c'est bien ça le gros problème. Les combats sont vraiment chiants à mourir, je vous parle même pas de ceux contre les nazguls qui franchement sont interminables à souhait et sans aucun plaisir. C'est franchement dommage, ya du potentiel mais pas d’efficacité. Concernant la gestion des alliés, c'est sympa (mention spéciale pour les fosses où tu fais combattre tes propres orcs mais faut aimer planifier et rien faire devant son écran, moi ça me parle plutôt mais c'est un jeu d'action donc je peux comprendre que ça soit lassant sachant que t'es un peu obligé de les faire combattre en théorie pour qu'ils deviennent plus forts) mais franchement, ça sert pas à grand chose. Les assauts des forts finalement c'est toujours toi qui a le dernier mot (qui doit capturer les points), ils finiront toujours dans ces situations à se faire défoncer si tu capture pas les points (mais ils mourront pas, ce qui en soi est un avantage parce que t'es pas pénalisé par le fait que tu capture pas le point par toi même, ils vont rentrer en phase de saignement, attendant des soins, mais ça n'a donc aucune saveur, tes orcs ne pouvant vraiment mourir pendant les assauts à part si t'es une vraie cave). Le pire c'est que t'attaque avec une armée, une dizaine voir une quinzaine de capitaine avec tous ceux que tu domines, mais tu finis en combat solo contre le chef de guerre et ses soldats, pourquoi ? 
Ce qui est vraiment sympa ça va être toute la partie interaction entre les orcs et de toi avec les orcs. Ayant une "mémoire", les orcs vont faire des allusions aux rencontres que tu as fais, tes orcs vont avoir des rivaux et vont mener des attaques sur des camps. Bref l'interaction entre pnj est ce qu'il y a de plus sympa (à regarder)

Le système d'inventaire est vraiment naze, j'ai rarement vu ça, autant rien mettre franchement et laisser le jeu en jeu d'action simple. Le leveling amène vraiment rien au jeu

(j'ai joué au jeu de base avec les dlc en difficulté normal (et heureusement parce que jouer en plus difficile avec la marge de gameplay de combat que tu as, l'enfer...), fini le scénario principal, j'ai lancé le scénario avec l'elfe dont j'ai oublié le nom, pas tenu plus de cinq minutes, j'ai lancé le dlc avec l'humain après en me disant ça va pimenter vu qu'on est sur une sorte de mode iron man, mais enfaite même ça c'est un un scam, tu meurs ça change pas grand chose, ils disent qu'il est "mortel" mais pas vraiment, tu perd juste ton stuff quoi ==> ET surtout : on est à ce stade sur un copié collé de arkham city étant donné que t'as un grappin exactement comme batman et qu'il manquait que ça avec le système némésis pour faire que ce soit le même jeu (sans les montures ok... mais je suis pas sur que ce personnage puisse avoir des montures dans tous les cas donc...) mais vu qu'on est sur le deuxième dlc, ça s'est pas vu ;) )

En résumé :

Scénario éclaté
Combats nuls à chier et vraiment ennuyant au possible
Grandes map sympas à parcourir mais des fois assez mal foutus et zones à prendre assez variées (j'ai pas étayé ce point mais bon, le game design est sympathique pour le coup)
Système "d'interaction" avec et entre les pnj vraiment bien (on peut pas discuter avec eux pour autant hein)
Utilité des alliés : presque nulle sauf à servir de diversion
Redondance du gameplay de fond (même si les quêtes annexes et les missions d'ennemi jurés sont assez sympas et contrebalancent ce point, mais sur tout ce qui suit l'histoire...)

Mot de la fin : Un assassin's creed seigneur des anneaux qui mériterait de revenir aux bases d'assassin's creed

note : 10/20

185876852.review:
WHAT A GAME.

This is a technical marvel of game development.
The nemesis system is a top-tier showcase on AI systems, the voice acting makes you forget you're watching a game, the cutscenes are breathtaking and the gameplay is TIGHT.

The devs optimized the heck out of this game, with so much simulation running on the background and still you can enjoy high frames on high quality models and textures.

The only downside I'd say is the story a bit. If you like LOTR, you'll enjoy the cameos of several known characters. But other than that the story is a bit bland.

The fortress system adds insane replayability and the online sieges allow the game to have the many players it has to this day.

9/10

185855522.review:
Um jogo que sofreu com a política predatória de microtransações. Pode ser odiado pelos fãs de Tolkien, mas inegavelmente cumpre seu papel como JOGO.

Veja bem, este game praticamente serra no meio a lore de LOTR, pense nele mais como um universo paralelo e jamais pergunte sobre esse jogo no r/LOTR. 

Agora, sobre o sistema Nemesis e a jogabilidade, poucos games da geração passada podem resistir ao tempo e ainda assim conceder uma gameplay satisfatória. ME:SW é um desses jogos. Você se sente poderoso e ao mesmo tempo vulnerável, onde a dificuldade "Brutal" é a melhor forma que eu encontrei de aproveitar esse game.

Sistema de habilidades, de equipamentos e o melhor, os capitães orcs que é o arroz com feijão desse jogo. Até hoje me lembro da primeira vez que consegui matar um capitão que sempre me derrotou, pra depois ele voltar ainda mais forte.
Gráficos bonitos, dublagem extremamente boa (embora eu tenha minhas dúvidas se a dublagem PTBR impede certos tipos de orcs aparecerem no jogo).

Não seja um burro igual a mim que focou nas armas lendárias. As armas épicas são as melhores por terem efeitos ABSURDOS (como a Wrathgiver, que concede Fúria quase infinita).

Shadow of War é um jogo sobre relacionamento do seu personagem com o mundo. Se você for agressivo, os capitães serão. Se for passivo, eles também.
Não foque em dominar ou matar os melhores capitães. Foque em criar histórias interessantes com os seus nemesis.

Que pena que a WB patenteou o sistema nemesis e não usou em jogos futuros.

Sobre as DLC's, creio que todas possuem seu valor. A desolação de Mordor é sem duvidas a melhor, onde você joga com outro protagonista em uma espécie de Roguelike, morreu, acabou.
A lamina de Galadriel é extremamente duvidosa, por ter dificuldade artificial, mas tem seu valor pelos orcs concedidos ao completar e pra saber um pouco mais sobre o futuro da saga.

Por fim, finalizo essa análise recomendando pra qualquer gamer que seja fascinado pela interação de seu personagem com o mundo. Shadow of War é facilmente top 3 melhores jogos da minha VIDA, junto de Red Dead Redemption 2.

Dêem uma chance para essa obra prima. E Warner, nos dê a continuação desse jogo, SEM ELTARIEL.

185667404.review:
Hikaye

Oyun, Talion ve Celebrimbor'un hikayesini sürdürüyor. İkili, Mordor üzerinde güç kazanmak ve Sauron'un ordusunu alt etmek için bir Yeni Güç Yüzüğü yaratıyor. Hikaye, orijinal Tolkien evreninden bazı sapmalar gösterse de, dinamik anlatımı ve sinematik sahneleriyle oldukça sürükleyici bir deneyim sunuyor.

Artılar: Derin bir hikaye anlatımı ve karakter gelişimi.
Eksiler: Tolkien'in eserlerine sadakat konusunda eleştiriler aldı.

Oynanış
Shadow of War, öncülü gibi açık dünya tabanlı bir aksiyon oyunudur. En dikkat çekici yönlerinden biri, geliştirilmiş Nemesis Sistemidir. Bu sistem, oyuncunun düşmanlarla olan etkileşimlerini hatırlayarak kişiselleştirilmiş bir deneyim sunar. Örneğin, bir ork tarafından öldürülürseniz, bu ork terfi eder ve bir sonraki karşılaşmada sizi hatırlar.

Artılar: Akıcı dövüş mekanikleri, geniş açık dünya, zengin görev çeşitliliği.
Eksiler: Mikro ödemeler sistemi başlarda eleştiri aldı, ancak geliştiriciler bu sistemi sonradan kaldırdı.

Grafikler ve Ses Tasarımı
Oyun, görsel olarak etkileyici bir deneyim sunuyor. Mordor'un karanlık ve tehditkâr atmosferi, detaylı çevre tasarımıyla desteklenmiş. Seslendirme performansları da güçlü ve oyunun atmosferine katkıda bulunuyor.

Artılar: Güçlü görsel ve ses tasarımı.
Eksiler: Bazı çevre detayları zamanla tekrara düşebiliyor.
Eksiler ve Tartışmalar

Shadow of War, piyasaya çıktığında içerdiği mikro ödemeler nedeniyle eleştirildi. Ancak topluluğun geri bildirimlerine kulak veren geliştiriciler, bu sistemi oyundan tamamen kaldırdı. Ayrıca, bazı oyuncular Tolkien evrenine yapılan uyarlamaların aşırı serbest olduğunu düşünüyor.

Sonuç;

Shadow of War, aksiyon dolu oynanışı, derin hikayesi ve yenilikçi Nemesis Sistemi ile oldukça etkileyici bir yapım. Ancak Tolkien fanatikleri için evrene yapılan değişiklikler can sıkıcı olabilir. Mikro ödeme sistemi kaldırıldığı için artık daha erişilebilir ve keyifli bir deneyim sunuyor.

Puan: 8.5/10
Tolkien evrenine aşina olanlar ve aksiyon-rol yapma oyunlarını sevenler için şiddetle tavsiye edilir.

185649067.review:
I have a bit of a mixed relationship with this game.  I played Shadow of Mordor years ago and loved it; it had great ideas, a solid execution, and it left me wanting more.  I tried Shadow of War right away when it came out and bounced right off; I have been tempted several times since but it never managed to get its hooks into me.

Recently, though, I got the bug and decided to try again, and I had a mostly good time; I know the grinding and loot box elements have been greatly reduced, and the game is better for it.  The only remaining problem, really, is that it is *too* long.  I can enjoy a game that has a lot going on and keeps on going, but Shadow of War doesn't have the variety it needs to support the sheer heft of it.  I definitely had to stop playing for a while several times because I got bored of playing it.

That being said, the game itself is actually good; it just feels like the developers bloated the runtime to make the online transactions more palatable.  If you have some time to delve into a game for quite a while, this is still a worthwhile journey.

185580654.review:
Shadow of War delivers a thrilling action-packed experience, set in the richly detailed world of J.R.R. Tolkien. One of the standout features is undoubtedly the innovative Nemesis System, which brings a dynamic and personal touch to gameplay. The system ensures that each encounter with an enemy feels unique, as they remember past conflicts, hold grudges, and evolve their strategies. It adds an extra layer of depth, making each player's journey distinct.

The removal of microtransactions has also been a significant improvement, enhancing the overall experience, since expending money to enjoy a pretty much singleplayer game is a crime. Players no longer feel pressured to spend extra money to progress, which keeps the gameplay fair and enjoyable for all.

However, despite these strengths, the game's narrative falls a bit flat. The main story lacks the compelling hooks needed to make it truly unforgettable, and the secondary characters often come across as one-dimensional and lack charisma. While the Nemesis System adds personal tales of revenge and rivalry, it’s a shame that the overarching story doesn’t quite match up to this ingenuity.

185531946.review:
A Bloated Sequel That Falls Short of Expectations

Middle-earth: Shadow of War tries to build upon its predecessor, Shadow of Mordor, but unfortunately, it stumbles under the weight of its own ambitions. While the game introduces some interesting ideas, it’s bogged down by a repetitive structure, grind-heavy mechanics, and questionable monetization choices that detract from the experience.

The much-touted Nemesis System feels less impactful this time around. While it’s still satisfying to face off against rival orcs, the system hasn’t evolved enough to feel fresh or innovative. Instead of building on the dynamic rivalries that made Shadow of Mordor unique, Shadow of War floods the player with endless orcs that start to blur together. The encounters lose their meaning and emotional weight after a few hours.

The story, sadly, is another weak point. It takes liberties with Tolkien’s lore in ways that feel forced and out of place, turning a rich and nuanced world into a generic backdrop for over-the-top action. Characters lack depth, and the plot relies on predictable twists and clichés. The inclusion of a Ring of Power storyline feels unnecessary and undermines the grounded narrative tone of the original game. By the end, it feels like the story is just an excuse to string together repetitive gameplay.

Speaking of gameplay, the open-world design feels bloated and uninspired. The map is divided into multiple regions, but most of them feel empty and lifeless, offering little reason to explore beyond collecting items or completing filler side quests. The combat, while fun at first, becomes a mindless button-mashing affair that gets old quickly. Siege battles, a major feature of the game, are initially exciting but quickly devolve into repetitive and tedious encounters.

One of the game’s most frustrating aspects is its heavy reliance on grinding. The final act, often referred to as the "Shadow Wars," feels like an artificial attempt to pad the game’s length. You’re forced to grind for stronger orcs and gear, which drags the pacing to a halt. This grind-heavy design feels particularly egregious given the game’s original implementation of loot boxes and microtransactions (since removed), which encouraged players to spend real money to bypass the monotony. Even with the microtransactions gone, the lingering design decisions make the experience feel like a chore.

On the positive side, the game is visually stunning, with detailed environments and cinematic cutscenes. The voice acting and music are solid, and some orc interactions can still be amusing. However, these positives are overshadowed by the game’s repetitive structure and lack of meaningful innovation.

In the end, Middle-earth: Shadow of War feels like a step backward. Instead of refining the strong foundation of Shadow of Mordor, it doubles down on unnecessary bloat, grindy mechanics, and a lackluster story. While there are moments of fun to be had, the overall experience is disappointing and struggles to justify its length.

[b][u]PROS:[/u][/b][i]
+ Nemesis System
+ cool maps, diverse and beautiful environments
+ tight game mechanics
+ a ton of character customization via equipping various items, plus some random skins
+ brutal dismemberment
+ a lot of stuff to do, two expansions are pretty rad
+ it can hype you up, somehow, I can't explain
+ orcs are just wild and banters are the best
+ shame mechanic, although I didn't use it much, can be cool, especially using it for revenge on a certain character after betrayal
+ very fun to play[/i]

[b][u]CONS:[/u][/b][i]
- game came out in a bad state, full of greedy mechanics
- late game tedium, more on that later
- inventory gets pretty stuffed with items you can't easily browse or have a general overview of
- game just got stuck on loading screen couple of times, hard exiting and restarting the game resolves this
- weird bug that almost blocked game progression - in a certain mission you have to free some friendly captain orcs and kill enemy captain orcs - but they didn't spawn. Reloading save didn't help, however exiting the game resolved the problem[/i]

---

It's a fun third person melee, action game with lite RPG elements. Gameplay is very fun and satisfying. You have an expanding skill set that you upgrade with skill points and items you upgrade with gems and doing certain tasks to level up an item. There are quite a few quests to do and gameplay mechanics but the main one at some point will be going straight for captains and warchiefs, avoiding fights with random orcs. However, there is always a chance that fight will become tad bit harder if a random captain just pops up and joins the kerfuffle, which happens more and more during gameplay, or you die and by that you promote a random orc to a captain. 

Real star of the show is the Nemesis System that is overhauled and way better than in the first game. Again, leave it to WB to trademark it and patent and then do nothing with it after this game. 
Besides it, game really has a bunch of different type of stuff to do, from hunting tribe chiefs, to invading castles/outposts, revenge mechanics, upgrading followers, riding dragons (drakes), online modes, gem crafting/upgrading, etc.

Now, I've enjoyed immensely but at some late point in the game, like, last fifth of it, it became really tedious and I really wanted it just to end. Everything kinda peaked and then a bunch of things changed and you had to play more to finish the game, with some really annoying fights. It all felt like they either tried to cram teasers for the next game but got carried away when they found out there wont be a next game. Or they planned even more gameplay for this game but had to cut it down for whatever reason. 
Whole ending is fast tracked and a bit all over the place. Story is in the same vein. Not really elaborate or has a certain tempo, it's just stuff happens and that's it. Thankfully, two expansions add a bit of fun to the pile by being slightly different from the main game. Especially Baranor expansion.

If you can get over the initial anti-consumer transgressions WB made with game, I can recommend it, you will have fun chopping all sorts of mouthy, filthy orcs. But wait for the sale.

185386830.review:
Shadow of War é, sem dúvida, um dos jogos mais incríveis que já tive o prazer de jogar. Ele leva a experiência dos jogos de ação e aventura a um novo nível, com uma jogabilidade dinâmica e uma história envolvente que não deixa a desejar. A combinação de combate visceral, exploração de mundos vastos e uma narrativa profunda faz desse título um marco dentro do gênero.

A história é fantástica e emocionante. Ela se passa no universo de O Senhor dos Anéis e faz um trabalho notável em expandir a trama ao mesmo tempo em que respeita o legado da obra de J.R.R. Tolkien. O jogo nos coloca no papel de Talion, um ranger de Gondor, que, junto com o espectro de Celebrimbor, busca vingar-se de Sauron e destruir seu exército. A missão de derrotar o Senhor das Trevas nunca foi tão empolgante, e a forma como o jogo mescla as intrigas políticas com a ação imersiva cria uma atmosfera única.

A jogabilidade é outro ponto alto. O sistema de combate é fluido, com uma variedade de habilidades e ataques que fazem cada batalha se sentir única. A mecânica de Nemesis, onde os inimigos lembram suas vitórias ou derrotas anteriores, adiciona uma camada de profundidade que torna as interações com os orcs ainda mais intensas e pessoais. É uma sensação única ver um inimigo que você derrotou anteriormente se vingar de você em uma futura batalha. Cada confronto se torna uma narrativa própria, e isso é algo raramente visto em outros jogos.

Além disso, a forma como o jogo integra um mundo aberto é excelente. O ambiente é rico em detalhes, e a exploração não é apenas uma atividade secundária, mas uma parte fundamental da experiência. Cada região é bem construída, com muitas missões secundárias e segredos a serem descobertos. Isso faz com que a jogabilidade se sinta mais orgânica e menos repetitiva.

O fator de personalização também merece destaque. A capacidade de melhorar seu personagem e suas habilidades ao longo do jogo é extremamente satisfatória. Além disso, o jogo oferece diferentes estratégias de jogo, dependendo de como você escolhe se envolver com os sistemas de guerra e suas forças. A maneira como você recruta orcs, constrói seu exército e confronta seus inimigos de forma estratégica faz com que cada jogada se sinta única.

No aspecto visual, Shadow of War é impressionante. O design dos personagens, especialmente dos orcs, é detalhado, com cada um apresentando características próprias. A modelagem dos cenários também é magnífica, com paisagens deslumbrantes e ambientes sombrios que capturam perfeitamente o clima da Terra-média.

Em termos de som, a trilha sonora é épica, trazendo músicas que ajudam a construir a tensão das batalhas e a grandiosidade das conquistas. Os efeitos sonoros também são bem feitos, tornando cada golpe e cada grito de batalha mais impactante.

Enfim, Shadow of War é um título que não só homenageia a obra de Tolkien, mas também oferece uma experiência de jogo memorável e cheia de emoção. Quem é fã de O Senhor dos Anéis vai se sentir em casa, mas mesmo quem não é tão familiarizado com a franquia vai encontrar um jogo empolgante e desafiador. Se você procura uma história envolvente, uma jogabilidade divertida e inovadora, e uma experiência imersiva, este jogo é, sem dúvida, uma excelente escolha. Como diria o próprio Talion: "Enquanto houver vida em meu corpo, meu destino é somente meu."

- Ologs are rad asf but sadly sooooo easy to fight against

185225968.review: Gameplay is tight and the Nemesis system is a genius idea

185224400.review:
It really does seem like the early game does a good job at making you feel like a badass. But that's about 20%-ish through the game. I was frustrated with Shadow of Mordor on how janky and inaccurate your character's movement is. A lot of times, when you jump/double-jump the character moves only a couple feet vs. other times when you can leap for miles. This really grinds against the movement system. The addition of Elven Movement made it so you can go even faster, but it's unreliable at the best of times. Not to mention the direct combat is horrible when it comes to you attempting to target specific enemies. You could be looking directly at them and your character will swing at someone off screen.

Combat is, at the best of times boring, and at the worst of times genuinely so awful I wanted to break knee caps. No chance is the worst feature in any game I've seen and pair that with later level enemies who have and will one-shot you. Or, worse than that, poison you which not only damages you, but effects your vision and hampers your movement. Oh, not to mention you don't have energy when poisoned and can't even start recovering until a set amount of time AFTER you lose the condition. When I mean a drop of movement speed I mean you're going around the map like a professional hockey champion and end up becoming a grandma with no legs.

TL;DR These things, among MANY others slow down the game and lead to, I believe, many players not wanting to play this game. It does a good job at making you feel powerful when the game doesn't straight up cheat you to die. Otherwise, it's a nonsensical mess with an honestly terrible story and no fulfillment in the actions you take. The fact it's critically acclaimed is only for the Nemesis system being unique and trademarked by Warner. Forcing people who want to experience it to play this game. It's comical that such a beloved world could be gatekept by such an awful experience in gaming.

185112229.review:
[b]Genel Bakış[/b]


Middle-earth: Shadow of War, Shadow of Mordor'un devamı olarak, Orta Dünya'da geçen aksiyon dolu bir deneyim sunuyor. Bu kez, Talion ve Celebrimbor’un kötülüğe karşı savaşı daha da genişliyor ve Mordor’u fethetme mücadelesiyle karşılaşıyoruz. Nemesis Sistemi geri dönüyor, ancak bu defa çok daha derinlemesine işlenmiş. Savaşlar daha geniş çapta ve farklı stratejiler gerektiriyor. Renkli açık dünya tasarımı, yeni karakterler, yerleşim yerleri ve önemli dünyalarla zenginleştirilmiş. Hikaye açısından, hikaye biraz daha öne çıkarılmış, fakat geçmişi kadar derin değil. War şehri sistemleri ve daha büyük konfrontasyonlarla, bu oyun pek çok yönüyle farklı bir deneyim sunuyor, fakat yine de bazıları için yer yer tekdüzeleşebiliyor.

[b]Oynanış Mekanikleri[/b]

Oynanış, öncekine benzer şekilde aksiyon dolu, fakat çok daha geniş çapta. Düşmanlar artık daha çeşitlenmiş ve yaratıklar da farklı yetenekler sunuyor. Gerçekten keyifli kılan kısım, düşmanları alt ettiğinizde ortaya çıkan Nemesis Sistemi’nin büyüklüğü. Bir ork lideriyle karşılaştığınızda yaşadığınız deneyimler hikayeyi değiştiriyor. Bunun dışında, savaşlar şimdi daha büyük ve etkileyici. Özel taktikler kullanarak, ok ve kalkanla düşmanları nasıl alt edeceğinizi seçebiliyorsunuz. Bazı yan görevler bir yandan yavan olabilir, ancak ana görevdeki büyüme hissiyatı, her zaman daha iyi seviyelere ulaşmak için zorlamaya devam ediyor. Yine de, belirli görevler döngüsel hale gelebilir.

[b]Grafikler ve Ses[/b]

Grafikler, önceki oyunun üzerinde büyük bir adım atmış ve Orta Dünya’yı daha canlı bir şekilde sunuyor. Görsellerde yer alan detaylar büyüleyici, özellikle savaş sahnelerinde çok daha akıcı ve etkileyici animasyonlar var. Pek çok yerleşim alanı çok daha canlı, fakat bunu etkileyen bazı küçük gözlemler de bulunuyor; örneğin, bazı animasyonlar hala genellikle ortalama seviyede kalabiliyor. Renk kullanımı ve çevre tasarımıyla açık dünya, oyuncuları etkileyip yorgunluk hissine kapılmasını engelliyor. Sesler ise başarılı; Orta Dünya’ya özgü orijinal müzikler ve atmosfer tam anlamıyla hissettiriliyor, ancak bazen dövüş ortamında ses dengesi tam oturamayabiliyor.

[b]Zorluk ve Derinlik[/b]

Zorluk seviyesi, farklı tipteki düşmanlar, büyük ordu savaşları ve daha fazla stratejiyle donatılmış. Ancak aynı zamanda sistem çok geniş bir hale gelmiş ve bazı oyuncuların beklediğinden daha fazla zaman alabiliyor. Eğer hala Shadow of Mordor'da olduğu gibi hızlı bir aksiyon ve sık mücadeleler arıyorsanız, bu çok daha uzun sürebilecek bir deneyim. Diğer yandan, görevler bazen tekrar edebiliyor ve zorluklar arttıkça, sıkıcılık da beraberinde gelebilir. Uğraştığınız harita, yapmanız gereken şeylerin yarısından fazlası tekrar eden türde olabilir. Ancak, açık dünya mücadeleleri kesinlikle takdir edilesi.

[b]Pozitif:[/b]

-Geliştirilmiş Nemesis Sistemi, daha derin düşman etkileşimleri
-Daha büyük ve dinamik açık dünya
-Zengin karakter gelişimi ve yetenek ağacı
-Akıcı dövüşler ve görsel efektler
-Muhteşem Orta Dünya atmosferi ve müzikleri

[b]Negatif:[/b]

-Yan görevler ve bazı aktiviteler tekrara düşebiliyor
-Grafikleri ve animasyonları bazen eski kalabiliyor
-Zorluk seviyesi özellikle ilerleyen bölümlerde artabiliyor, sıkıcı hale gelebilir
-Hikaye derinliği önceki oyuna göre zayıf

[b]Genel Değerlendirme[/b]

[b]Oynanış:[/b] 8/10 (Aksiyon ve dövüş dinamikleri geliştirilen yapısı ile eğlenceli fakat bazı görevlerde tekrara düşülüyor)
[b]Grafikler:[/b] 8/10 (Görsel gelişim başarılı ancak bazı animasyonlar ve içerikler hala eski kalabiliyor)
[b]Hikaye:[/b] 6/10 (Farklı bir hikaye akışı sunuluyor, ancak daha derin bir evrim olmamış)
[b]Genel:[/b] 8/10

[b]Sonuç[/b]

Middle-earth: Shadow of War, yenilikçi nemesis sistemi, geliştirilmiş dövüş mekanikleri ve genişletilmiş açık dünya ile önemli bir adım atmış bir oyun. Ancak, her yeni mekanik ve sistem yanında yine zamanla tekdüzeleşen bir yapı barındırıyor. Görevlerde tekrar eden yapılar ve bazı unsurlar, uzun süreli oyun deneyiminde sıkıcılığa yol açabiliyor. Yine de, Orta Dünya evreni ve bol aksiyon arayışı içindeki oyuncular için oldukça zevkli bir deneyim sunuyor.

184986278.review:
After watching some streamers play some of the game, I bought the game during the Winter Sale. Overall I'll give it a 6.5 out of 10 for me. 

The core game play of the nemesis system is great, better than the first one but I didn't like the story line and I found the character skill system frustrating. The system has you unlock a core skill/ability and then to spend additional level points for an additional "flavor" for the skill. What was frustrating was that you can only have one of the two/ three options active at at time despite how some of the options should have been a "passive" you can keep with another upgrade instead of being an active skill. This artificially extended the game play because it made the player choose to either farm for weapon upgrades vs passive combat upgrades. 

It can be argued that this was done to allow players to make the play through "unique" but when you have to trade a a passive skill to dominate orcs faster vs A BETTER CHANCE TO farm better quality items (its not that noticeably better) it's not a unique change in game play. 

I will admit, It's not game breaking but the longer you play, the more noticeable the skill system becomes.

184944893.review:
Dieses Spiel unterstützt uncapped FPS bei 4K-Auflösung und HDR. Alleine das ist schon sehr selten, vor allem bei Spielen, die mittlerweile über 7 Jahre alt sind. Die Grafik ist vergleichbar gut mit the Witcher 3, also äußerst gut. Der integrierte Fotomodus ist wirklich super, das einzige Manko ist, dass er keine Auslösetaste hat. Um ein Bild zu machen, muss ich die Steam-Methode durch Drucktaste auslösen, wenn man jetzt auf dem Bett am Fernseher mit Controller spielt, ziemlich umständlich. 

Dieser Teil steht seinem Vorgänger in nichts nach, im Gegenteil wurde auch hier Feedback sehr gut umgesetzt. Das ganze System der Armee ist und bleibt sehr einzigartig. Ich habe zuerst nicht viel von diesem Spiel erwartet, aber es hat mir schon von Anfang überraschend viel Spaß gemacht. Man kann an so ziemlich jeder Struktur greifen und sich darüber hinwegbewegen, dadurch ist man extrem mobil unterwegs, davon dürfte sich AC ruhig eine Scheibe abschneiden. Der Schleichmodus macht sehr viel Spaß und verzeiht auf normalem Schwierigkeitsgrad viele Fehler.

Die Festungseroberungen sind jetzt noch größer. Überraschungsangriffe, Verrat, Blutbrüderschaften und andere Funktionen halten die Spielwelt interessant und abwechslungsreich. Die Fähigkeiten sind gut ausgewogen und bieten eine Menge Möglichkeiten für die eigene Spielweise.  Die Artefakte erzählen mehr über die Geschichte Mordors und sind wirklich sehr detailliert gestaltet worden. Allgemein ist die Geschichte gut erzählt.

Wer den ersten Teil gut fand und die Geschichte von Herr der Ringe auch so gut findet wie ich, der wird auch mit diesem Teil sehr zufrieden sein.

Playing on easy is the only route if you want to enjoy some of this game. 

  If feels like there are two sides to this coin. On one hand, the design & creation process of this game is genuinely amazing. More than a few times I was amazed aspects of the game & was purely loving the content in front of me. I can't say I agree with the plot but THAT, is my opinion & I expect games to have a crowd of diverse opinions. 
  However, in all aspects aside from the concept/design, its ...borderline unplayable. It doesn't feel like this game was played before they release it because there are so so many SHOckingly back game mechanics, half of which are semi/entirely broken (ex. getting killed in a cut scene where you are unable to move.... This happened MANY times, & if one had played, this would be easily noticeable). All of the gamemodes include terrible game mechanics, completely sucking 94% of the fun for me personally. 
  I played the entire base game in the hardest difficulty, & the dlcs in the easiest, & I can say I hardly feel a difference besides how hard they hit. At least that was enough to enjoy other aspects of the game they actually put effort into, but even with it at its easiest, those same game mechanics will push through the difficulty barrier & once again ruin the fun. Obviously you can avoid them easier but at that point I'm avoiding playing the game as intended.
  Cal's voice acting if Phenomenal! All the Voice actors did well but the graphics were more charming in Shadow of Mordor, along side some characters (Talion in particular) look uncanny compared to the former game. I could go on for a while about my issues with this game but it does have a few redeeming qualities & definitely has fun within, its just so easily overlooked by horrid execution :(

184850752.review:
[h1] Middle-earth: Shadow of War: 100% Achievement Completion Review (Including DLCs) [/h1]

[h3] Main Components for 100% Completion[/h3]
[b]Story Achievements:[/b]
- Completing the main story on different difficulties unlocks several achievements.
- Focus on progressing through the narrative in the base game.

[b]Nemesis System:[/b]
- Dominate, recruit, and betray orcs for various achievements.
- Conquer forts, manage orc captains, and complete siege missions.
- Some achievements tied to specific types of orcs or captains.

[b]Collectibles:[/b]
- Artifacts: Scattered across the world, require solving puzzles or completing challenges.
- Training Grounds: Complete challenges to unlock skill-related achievements.
- Skill Trees: Maximize Talion’s abilities and complete associated challenges.

[b]Side Missions & Challenges:[/b]
- Timed challenges, epic sieges, and orc-specific objectives.
- Epic Siege Missions: Special battles requiring strategic planning.
- War Chefs & Trials: Complete specific objectives in limited timeframes.

[b]Endgame – Shadow Wars:[/b]
- A series of challenging fortress sieges after the main story.
- Requires maintaining an army, defending against waves, and careful planning.
- Often considered the most time-consuming part.

[h3]DLC Achievements[/h3]
[b]The Desolation of Mordor:[/b]
- New area and story missions set in the deserts of Mordor.
- Includes new achievements tied to quests, collectibles, and combat challenges.
- Requires mastering new mechanics and enemies unique to this expansion.

[b]The Blade of Galadriel:[/b]
- New playable character, the Elven assassin Eltariel.
- New combat mechanics and abilities, along with fresh story missions.
- Achievements tied to completing story missions and challenges as Eltariel.

[b]The Slaughter Tribe & Outlaw Tribe:[/b]
- New Orc Tribes with additional Nemesis System content.
- Players must defeat these new tribes and earn achievements related to their unique captains and challenges.

[h3]Challenges & Time Commitment[/h3]
[b]Time to Completion:[/b]
- Base Game: around 30-40hours for 100% completion.
- DLCs: Add an additional 10-20 hours, depending on how thoroughly you tackle each expansion.
- Completing DLC achievements requires revisiting mechanics, mastering new characters, and engaging in new storylines and challenges.
- Grinding: Some achievements require repetition, such as defeating captains or collecting all artifacts.
- Repetitiveness: Endgame sieges and Nemesis System interactions may feel grind-heavy, especially with the DLC tribes.

[h3]Combat & Gameplay[/h3]
- Fluid, dynamic combat with varied enemy types (orcs) that require different tactics.
- Nemesis System adds depth, creating a constantly evolving challenge.
- Loot Boxes (removed in updates): Microtransactions originally affected progression, now less of an issue.
- DLCs introduce new mechanics and characters with unique abilities, adding fresh layers to the gameplay.

[h3]Final Thoughts[/h3]
[b]Pros:[/b]
- Immersive world with rich lore, strategic combat, and unique system mechanics.
- Rewarding to fully master the Nemesis System and conquer Mordor.
- DLCs offer new content, fresh challenges, and unique gameplay experiences.

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Some grind-heavy elements, particularly in Shadow Wars.
- Repetitive tasks for 100% completion can be draining, especially with DLC challenges.

[b]Recommendation:[/b]
If you're a fan of the Lord of the Rings universe, enjoy action-packed gameplay, and love the challenge of 100% completion, Middle-earth: Shadow of War is highly recommended.

184725608.review:
Shadow of War ist meiner Meinung nach eine absolute Spielperle. Ich habe das Spiel für einen Spottpreis im Sell ergaunert und das bringt einem schon fast ein schlechtes Gewissen weil ich so sehr Spass an dem Spiel hatte.
Es ist zwar schon ein paar Jahre alt und mit dem DLC ist die Spielzeit so grade um die 100 Std (je nach Schwierigkeit), dies mindert aber nicht den Gesamteindruck.
Die Story ist okay da die Charaktere nicht viel zeit und Tiefe bekommen aber was daraus gemacht wurde reicht vollkommen um in der Geschichte von Tolkien Platz nehmen zu können.
Das Spiel glänzt aber durch das Nemesissystem der Gegner und durch die Fähigkeiten und der Ausrüstung von dem Basegame.
Das erste Addon mit Eltariel (Die klinge von Galadriel) war nicht wirklich meins. Es war kurz und fühlte sich nicht wirklich wie ein Addon im klassischen Sinne an. Die auswählbaren Fähigkeiten und Ausrüstungen waren ein Tropfen an Vielseitigkeit und Personifizierung im Gegensatz  zum Fluss der Möglichkeiten des Basegames.

Das Addon "Die Verwüstung Mordors" ist ein ganz anderes Thema. Oh boy das Addon hat mich komplett abgeholt durch seinen Anfangs riesigen Schwierigkeitsgrad. Generell habe ich das Game auf der schwierigsten Stufe durchgespielt. Grade im dem Addon wo man von vorne anfangen muss wenn man stirbt gab dem Spiel einen anderen Ton und frischen Wind.
Schade ist nur das es auch mit einer sich"geschlossen" Map selbst beschränkt und das Addon auch relativ kurz ist.
Wenn man die Story und das Ziel des Addons abschließt war es das auch mit dem Spiel. Hier hätten mehr Maps und oder einen noch größeren Schwierigkeitsgrad einen besseren wiederspielwert. 

ich kann das Spiel nur herzlich Empfehlen und bin selber traurig das wir keinen dritten Teil dieser Spielereihe sehen werden.

184561962.review:
[h1]⚔️ **Middle-earth™: Shadow of War™ : Le Mordor comme terrain de jeu** ⚔️[/h1]  
[p]Temps de jeu : Suffisant pour conquérir le Mordor, reconstruire une armée, et devenir le pire cauchemar de Sauron.[/p]  
[p]Genre : Action-RPG en monde ouvert avec du combat brutal et une gestion de guerre d’un nouveau niveau.[/p]  
[hr]  
[p]**Middle-earth™: Shadow of War™** est un retour triomphal en Terre du Milieu. Vous incarnez Talion, un ranger possédé par l'esprit de Celebrimbor, et ensemble, vous partez pour une opération "on vole les orques et on envahit leurs forteresses". Ajoutez à cela le système Nemesis, qui donne vie à chaque capitaine orque avec leurs propres personnalités et rancunes, et vous obtenez une aventure à couper le souffle où chaque victoire a un goût épique.[/p]  
  
[h2]Gameplay et contenu :[/h2]  
[p]⚔️ **Des combats fluides et viscéraux** : Adoptez des mécaniques de combat dynamiques qui combinent parade, esquive et coups fatals. Chaque bataille est une danse mortelle qui ferait rougir Aragorn lui-même.[/p]  
[p]🌍 **Un monde ouvert vaste et varié** : Explorez des régions du Mordor allant des plaines cendreuses aux forteresses imposantes. Chaque zone regorge de secrets à découvrir, d’ennemis à recruter ou à éliminer, et de trésors à ramasser.[/p]  
[p]👑 **Le système Nemesis** : Chaque capitaine orque que vous rencontrez est unique, avec sa propre histoire, ses forces et ses faiblesses. Vous êtes battu par un capitaine ? Pas de souci, il reviendra plus fort et plus arrogant, prêt à vous rappeler votre humiliation. Un vrai soap opéra de guerre orque ![/p]  
[p]🏰 **Sièges de forteresses** : Rassemblez votre armée d’orques et menez des attaques épiques contre des forteresses ennemies. Chaque siège est un véritable test de stratégie, de coordination et de pur chaos.[/p]  
[p]🛠️ **Personnalisation et évolution** : Améliorez vos compétences, votre équipement et votre armée. Devenir le seigneur ultime du Mordor n’est pas une mince affaire, mais les possibilités sont à couper le souffle. Et avouons-le, avoir une armée d’orques qui scandent votre nom, c’est énorme.[/p]  
  
[h2]Les points positifs :[/h2]  
[p]🌟 **Le système Nemesis évolué** : Jamais deux parties ne se ressemblent grâce aux interactions uniques avec les capitaines orques. C’est comme si chaque capitaine avait un contrat pour jouer le rôle de votre rival personnel.[/p]  
[p]🎨 **Des visuels impressionnants** : Du design des orques à la grandeur des forteresses, tout respire l’épique. Vous pourriez presque sentir la cendre dans l’air.[/p]  
[p]🎮 **Des sièges intenses et stratégiques** : Les batailles pour les forteresses sont parmi les moments les plus excitants du jeu.[/p]  
[p]😂 **Un humour sombre omniprésent** : Les interactions avec les orques oscillent entre menace et comédie. Certains capitaines pourraient presque lancer leur propre stand-up Mordorien.[/p]  
  
[h2]Les points négatifs :[/h2]  
[p]⏳ **Un grind parfois présent** : Certaines missions secondaires et la progression vers les batailles finales peuvent sembler un peu trop répétitives. Mais que serait le Mordor sans un peu de sueur et de sang ?[/p]  
[p]💼 **Microtransactions inutiles** : Heureusement retirées depuis, elles ont laissé un léger goût amer. Maintenant, tout peut être gagné à la force de votre glaive (et de votre patience).[/p]  
[p]🤖 **IA inégale** : Les orques peuvent parfois être géniaux... ou complètement idiots. Une vraie loterie Mordorienne.[/p]  
  
[hr]  
[p]🏆 **Le platine ?** Comptez au moins 60-80 heures pour conquérir toutes les forteresses, maxer vos orques et affronter les pires capitaines que le système Nemesis puisse générer. Une véritable épopée, digne d’une place dans les annales de la Terre du Milieu.[/p]  
  
[p]En résumé, **Middle-earth™: Shadow of War™** est une véritable lettre d’amour à l’univers de Tolkien. Entre combats viscéraux, système Nemesis révolutionnaire et moments d’épique intensité, ce jeu transforme le Mordor en votre terrain de jeu personnel. Alors, préparez votre armure, appelez votre warg, et partez à la conquête de la terre de Sauron ! ⚔️🔥

184488615.review:
To this day remains one of the most refreshing and unique takes on video game AI. So much so that I almost want to say It's a must-play for everyone with a fascination in smart AI and dynamic gameplay experiences.

Every single enemy character in this game, aside from a few in the tutorial missions, are all procedurally generated, and all have their own active stories they pursue in the backround while you pursue yours. Get in their way? You've made a nemesis for life until you either kill them, or forcefully recruit them into your own army, to which they will then become a recurring ally instead of a recurring enemy!

Each orc has their own unique class, personality, and relationships, both with you and other orcs. In-fighting to capitalize on? Check. Allies deciding to randomly betray you for their own gain? Check. Allies saving your life from near death experiences? Check. Enemies surviving their OWN near death experiences? Check. Allies surviving near death experience THEN betraying you? Check!

Make many memorable orc enemies as you rampage through Middle-Earth, forming your own army and capturing fortresses, all while upgrading yourself and the orcs you surround yourself with, sending them on their own missions and ordering them to defend both you and the fortresses you've captured. Bored of singleplayer? Take your armies to online sieges!

It's sad but impressive to say that I've really not seen many games since Shadow of War that expands upon AI further than it has, and once you give it a try yourself you'll begin to understand why It's so beloved for It's nemesis system!

184395812.review:
"Middle-earth: Shadow of War" is less about taking down Sauron and more about managing your overly ambitious HR department of orcs. Imagine running a company where every employee has dreams of stealing your job, and every meeting ends with someone trying to stab you in the back.

Let’s talk about those random moments of chaos. I sent my orc followers to defend a fortress, and what happens? Some random grunt strolls up, looks me dead in the eye, and says, “I’m gonna be your new captain now,” then attacks me in front of everyone. No handshake, no resume, no formalities. Just straight-up ambition. He didn’t even try to recruit me first! He lasted about 30 seconds, but hey, I respect the hustle.

Shadow of War is an endless loop of absurdity, where your allies become backstabbing maniacs, orcs rise to power through sheer incompetence and weird luck, and the game throws curveballs at you like a drunken orc throwing his axe at the wrong target.

184237818.review: 1折入手的游戏按理来说不应该给不推荐的，如果是十年前应该很喜欢这个游戏，但以现在的眼光来看一些问题还是比较突出：一是剧情比较薄弱，这个游戏应该有前作，不过不了解也没啥关系，反正主线没啥内容，个人是直奔第二章抓兽人去的，前面剧情恨不得直接跳过。二是游戏性问题，这个游戏的精髓用兽人宝可梦概括十分贴切，兽人都有各自的特性、弱点，行动AI也有所差别，真有点宝可梦个体值的味道了，游戏时间的一半基本上花在抓兽人和竞技场上，攻城战也设计的很有意思，但除此以外也有战斗系统手感不佳、日常任务无趣的问题，几类武器中除弓箭外，都不是很好用，常常一头扎进兽人堆里疯狂左右键互搏，30小时后慢慢觉得无趣了。第三个是画面问题，虽然游戏有100个G，但主要容量应该是用来塑造千奇百怪的兽人，画面及美术效果真的很一般，大概是10年左右的水平，玩久了略微会有点头晕。第四点是个人觉得按键设置怎么改都始终有点不顺手，30个小时后还是频发失误，有点影响游戏体验。总的说来折扣价还是可以入手的，但也没有非常出彩之处。

耐玩，很耐玩，零碎也是真的零碎，得不停切几个大地图看哪里有任务蹦出来，真是难受。
系统东西缝合的很多，但是有趣的不多，技能算一个，但是也太尼玛稀碎了，几十个技能，每个技能两三个分支，最关键还得来回调换。。。问题是不换都不行，有些任务必须得特定分支才能接，让你挨个看蚂蚁大小的分支技能名字找，反人类属于是。有些BOSS会对特定动作或者属性免疫或者兴奋。。还得调，我了个去，主打一个费劲。
战斗更是五花八门，各种的机制，还得看小BOSS技能，每个队长多的都尼玛几十个技能，不看不行，因为上文说了有些属性和攻击打没用。导致打的很不痛快。
追随者系统也是问题很多，比如有些队长全程激怒，一秒不停，支配控制都不好使，再遇见个没弱点，禁空，免疫冰冻的传奇诅咒狂战士能打的你自闭，摸你一两下就死。只能一直翻滚，要是旁边再有他的小弟，那分分钟死回去。最重要我玩的也只是普通难度。。
装备更新传奇级的很鸡肋，前期根本凑不齐套装，而且传奇升级太麻烦，史诗的又不够强力。
    最最最最最恶心的就是本作的NPC对话，我艹了个DJ了，每个队长最少一大段，还不能跳过，一个地图少说几十个队长，时间全浪费在上面了，而且一个队长不只是一段，有可能打一个队长蹦出来三四段对话，战斗时机啊什么的全耽误了，每个都硬拖几分钟时间，太sb了这个设定，设计师怎么想的是。还尼玛打死了以后还卷土重来，还死里逃生，还蹦出来伏击，背叛我。越说越来气，我就艹了你大爷。

Este juego sinceramente vale la pena, me pille los dos en un pack de 7 euros y les he echado unas 80 horas en total.
A este en concreto, más de 200, me lo pase en Xbox 2 veces sin los dlcs y ahora 1 vez con todo.
La historia no está nada mal, pero no es canon respecto con el universo de Tolkien. 
El sistema némesis se ha mejorado y el hecho de poder liderar ejércitos orcos añade muchas horas de juego y misiones y rejugabilidad. También mejorar a los orcos con órdenes de entrenamiento para ser más fuertes.
La campaña es algo corta y después de esta lo último que queda es defenderte, si estas curtido y tienes cuidado no será muy difícil, pero si es lo contrario prepárese mentalmente para no estampar algo contra la pantalla.
Hay varias dificultades aunque lo recomendable y lo estandarizado es la normal.
Los pozos de peleas y conquistas en línea a la larga se vuelven repetitivas, lo bueno de las primeras es que son automáticas, esto no es obligatorio a no ser que quieras el 100 % (el 100 % es bastante fácil y se puede conseguir en menos de 50 horas).
En general el juego es muy bueno, lástima que no sepamos más de esta saga y del sistema némesis.
9/10

183656755.review:
As a fan of *Shadow of Mordor*, I had high hopes for *Shadow of War*, but unfortunately, the game falls flat in several crucial areas. What was once a fresh and engaging formula devolves into a repetitive grind that undermines the series’ potential.

**First, the story**: It's a mess. While *Shadow of Mordor* had a relatively simple but effective narrative, *Shadow of War* tries to go bigger and ends up getting lost in a convoluted plot. The story feels disjointed, with forced cameos from familiar characters and an overemphasis on uninteresting side quests. Talion and Celebrimbor’s dynamic, which was one of the first game's highlights, feels strained and lacks the emotional depth needed to make the stakes feel real.

**The combat** is still fun, don’t get me wrong, but it’s more of the same from the first game with a few new bells and whistles that, honestly, don't add much. The Nemesis System, which was the standout feature of *Shadow of Mordor*, has been expanded, but not in ways that enhance the experience. Yes, it’s satisfying to watch orcs betray and rise through the ranks, but it quickly becomes repetitive, and the novelty wears off fast. Killing the same enemies over and over, just to see them return in a new position, feels hollow after a while.

But where the game truly stumbles is in its **monetization**. The loot boxes and microtransactions are egregious, and they taint the overall experience. They’re pushed heavily throughout the game, and it often feels like you're being nudged (or rather, shoved) to buy them if you want to make any real progress. It’s frustrating that a single-player game of this scale would rely on such shady practices, as it detracts from what could have been a more immersive experience.

**The open world** is another letdown. While visually stunning, it’s filled with repetitive tasks that quickly grow tiresome. The lack of meaningful variety in objectives makes it feel more like a chore than an adventure. And don’t even get me started on the "endgame" – the fortress sieges, meant to be a big highlight, are more tedious than exciting, with a grind for gear and orc captains that feels unnecessarily drawn out.

Finally, **performance issues** were a problem for me. Despite playing on a decent rig, I encountered stuttering and frame rate drops during intense battles, which really took me out of the experience.

In the end, *Shadow of War* feels like an uninspired cash grab that attempts to build on its predecessor's success without really advancing the formula in any meaningful way. What could have been an epic follow-up to *Shadow of Mordor* instead feels like a bloated, grind-heavy game that fails to capture the magic of the original. If you’re looking for an engaging, single-player adventure, you’re better off looking elsewhere.

183616523.review:
I came back to this game recently wondering if would still hold up, or if all the added mechanics and focus on fortress assaults meant I would love Shadow of Mordor more. And I have to say, I was kinda right...

Coming from Shadow of Mordor, the level system really put a crimp in my day: What do you mean I can't dominate whatever orc captain I want? And having to progress each of the different storylines in order to play the one I actually wanted felt somewhat tedious.

But you know what? That was it. Those were the only downsides. I had so much fun just playing the parts of the game that I found fun, rather than trying to be completionist about it. Returning to this game as an orc-slaying sandbox really feels like the way to enjoy it. You get more abilities, better traversal options, more unique orcs with unique dialogue, some cool fortress mechanics that only get old if you play them all the time. More mounts. Nazgul! Seriously this game is a ton of fun! If you allow yourself to ignore the repetitiveness that came with the increased scope of this game, it holds up well!

I still think Shadow of Mordor feels like a better game. It feels more focused, more personal. But the story and scope of this game work well for a sequel. I love playing both and both have a permanent home on my computer.

183585377.review:
Всё равно никто не прочитает мой отзыв, поэтому ловите рецепт топовых куриных котлет.
Ингредиенты:
- 500 г куриного или индюшиного фарша (можно использовать и говядину, если предпочитаете)
- 1 небольшая луковица
- 1 морковь
- 1 яйцо
- 2-3 ст. ложки овсяных хлопьев (или панировочных сухарей)
- Соль и перец по вкусу
- Специи (по желанию: паприка, чеснок, зелень)
- Оливковое масло для смазывания формы

Приготовление:
1. **Подготовка овощей:** Лук и морковь мелко нарезаем или натираем на терке. Это придаст котлетам сочность и аромат.

2. **Смешивание ингредиентов:** В глубокой миске соединяем фарш, лук, морковь, яйцо и овсяные хлопья. Хорошо перемешиваем до однородной массы. Не забудьте добавить соль, перец и специи по вкусу!

3. **Формирование котлет:** Смачиваем руки водой и формируем котлеты желаемого размера. Вы можете сделать их как большими, так и маленькими – на ваше усмотрение.

4. **Выпекание:** Выкладываем котлеты на противень, предварительно смазанный оливковым маслом. Ставим в разогретую до 180°C духовку и запекаем около 25-30 минут, до золотистой корочки.

5. **Подача:** Готовые котлеты можно подавать с гарниром из овощей или картофельным пюре. Они отлично сочетаются с легким салатом из свежих овощей.

can recommend, good fun, good story, it's also interesting that dying is part of the game and woven into the narrative and character, it's generally not treated as a temporary mistake, where you have to try again. Also you get the chance for revenge. 
Even the endgame and epilogue is not treated as a small rollback where you get to play before the end (if that makes sense like in other games), it's part of the story, and care is taken to explain it within the lotr universe and fit it in.

Frustrating things are that, the same one button climbs, jumps, dashes, dodges, vaults, rolls and more, so its very easy for the game to do something you didn't want and you having to pay for it. And sometimes it won't do the right thing even though you're on a tiny step and talion can't jump off because he's busy dashing in place.

unsure if i will buy the definitive edition for the extra dlcs
